description: Learned borrowing from Latin lūbricus (“slippery”). Doublet of lubricious.

adjectives.description: lubricous (comparative more lubricous, superlative most lubricous)

examples: But my Leech—a leechFit to suck blood, with lubricous round rings,Capaciously expatiative, which makeHis little body like a red balloon,As full of blood as that of hydrogene,Sucked from men’s hearts
